definitions.definition: an introduction to a book, typically stating its subject, scope, or aims.
examples: introduction, foreword, preamble, prologue, prelude; Morefront matter; informalprelims, intro, lead-in; formalexordium, proem, prolegomenon "the preface to the novel"Morefront matter; prelims, intro, lead-in; exordium, proem, prolegomenon the preface to the novel

definitions.definition: the introduction or preliminary part of a speech or event.
the introduction to the central part of the Eucharist, historically forming the first part of the canon or prayer of consecration.

examples: the book is prefaced by a quotation from William Faulkner
synonyms: start "the chapter is prefaced by a poem"

definitions.definition: introduce or begin (a speech or event) with or by doing something.
examples: it is important to preface the debate with a general comment
